title: How to run Ubuntu on Raspberry Pi - Quora

response.answer_text: You cannot use the ordinary x86 or AMD64 versions of ubuntu, but the raspberry pi foundation officially supports a whole lot of operating systems. Ubuntu themselves have made several versions of Ubuntu made for SBCs like the raspberry pi. On Raspberry Pi Downloads - Software for the Raspberry Pi, you can find download links for both the IoT Core ubuntu(very light version, saves resources) or Ubuntu MATE, more like the original Ubuntu distros. After downloading, you can install it like any other OS for the Pi, using the guide at Setting up your Raspberry Pi

Yes you can run full Ubuntu Desktop on your raspberry pi.You can install either 32 bit or 64 bit image. 1st you need to install preinstalled arm image then install desktop environment GUI. Here you will find step by step guide video how to install Ubuntu 20.04 LTS on raspberry pi 4 (Full UI)
